paragraphs: After a seven-year hiatus, direct air communication between Prague and Philadelphia will resume. American Airlines will start servicing the route from May 21, 2026. This was announced by the press service of Václav Havel Prague Airport.
The seasonal flight will operate until October 5 of the same year. The Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner aircraft will fly between the cities on a daily basis.
The duration of the journey will be 9 hours.
The departure from Philadelphia is scheduled for 18:40 local time with arrival in Prague at 08:45 the following day. The return flight will depart at 11:00 with arrival at 14:00 local time.
The ticket prices are currently unknown. They will go on sale in the coming days.

"The direct connection between Prague and Philadelphia was one of our priorities. Therefore, we are very pleased with the successful partnership with American Airlines, made possible through coordinated support and collaboration with our partners. We are confident that this flight will be successful and beneficial for both Czech passengers and tourists and business travelers heading to Prague," said Jiri Pos, Chairman of the Board of Prague Airport.
Let's note that Philadelphia Airport is an important hub for connecting flights. From there, passengers can reach 120 cities in North and Central America.
Today, the Czech Republic and the USA are connected by just one direct flight - between Prague and New York. It is operated by Delta Air Lines.
